features: 1G D3 64-bit - Video graphics card powered by AMD chipset with max 1334 MHz memory clock, for smooth general office tasks, and applications.

Easy to Install - This GPU graphic card just has 60W of power, no external power supply, so less heat will be released, and long service life. Low profile graphics card is for small form factor cases.

2 x HDMI Output - The high-quality electrical components and PCB plate ensure its safety and stability. 2 interfaces support multiple screen outputs, support watching 2K content. (Audio output support x1)
Super Reasonable Budget for Office - Good value option for you on a budget that needs an extra boost in screen performance, such as office work, video editing, coding.

Compatibility - Driver version is Crimson Edition 16.2.1 Beta, dated 3/1/2016 for Win 7, 8, 10 (not available for Win 11). This gpu compatible with most motherboards with PCIe slots. If you have any questions, please don't hesitate to contact us.
body.description: HD 6570 graphics card is powerful AMD Radeon HD 6000 Series for extremely smooth software experiences. This graphics card for pc fits for mini-itx, itx, atx motherboard. Tip: This GPU is good for budget GPU, starters, average users. Recommend looking up benchmarks to see if this is what you're after.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Disable UEFI Secure Boot in BIOS
reviews.reviewText: I installed this in my low profile Dell Inspiron and the machine wouldn't boot. I suspected a power supply problem but needed to make sure it wasn't the BIOS since I've seen these issues before. After about 10 minutes of research I found to disable UEFI Secure Boot. It booted after the change was saved. Also, I have Ubuntu Linux. I didn't even need to install drivers. It worked right out of the box which almost never happens. I'm so happy I didn't waste time introducing new hardware. The machine has a tiny footprint. It fit fine where other graphic cards didn't fit. Glad I gave it a try

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 3, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Worked in a Dell Optiplex 3020
reviews.reviewText: Was easy to install, and it worked in an older Dell Optiplex 3020 which had built in vga and displayport outputs but the displayport stopped working. Worked at first startup after installing but on a basic Windows driver at a lower resolution. Very easy to go onto the website and update the driver, and within a few minutes it was working with all the features and at optimal resolution.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Works great in my really old shop computer
reviews.reviewText: This video card works great in older computers. I am using this card in a computer that runs my CNC laser cutter with one monitor displaying G-Code and the other with the machine interface. As another reviewer stated do not waste your time trying to use the drivers on the included CD, just go to the vendor website and download the latest.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars This is not a gamer card, but it does present a good picture
reviews.reviewText: The Video card on my Desktop died. I installed this card and plugged in my two screens, and it came right up. I then installed the drivers, and now it works better than ever. I love it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Video is Good, Fan is LOUD
reviews.reviewText: Fan out the box was loud as could be. Really annoying when your tower is behind your monitors. Installed as it should no issues there. Fit great and works great, but the fan is so loud and annoying!!!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 14, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Helping me extend my use of my old Lenovo M93p small form factor computer
reviews.reviewText: This review is for the 1G model of this video card.My computer is old. It's a Lenovo M93p small form factor machine that I bought reconditioned several years ago, and when the Lenovo web site detected it, it told me that the warranty started in 2014, so the machine is now 9 years old. I'm frugal, though, and I try to squeeze all the use I can out of my things.I recently bought a new 29-inch wide monitor. The monitor only has HDMI inputs. My computer only had display port and VGA outputs for video. So for a short time, I had to use a VGA to HDMI adapter to use this new monitor. Using the adapter, my alternatives for my screen were a resolution that filled the entire monitor but with distortion, or a resolution that did not distort but left black "sidebars." I needed a new video card with an HDMI port to make good use of my new monitor.I looked online at video cards and saw that for most of them, a power supply of 300 watts or more is recommended. I found that the power supply for my computer only puts out 240 watts, and apparently replacement power supplies for my small form factor computer are not available, or would be too complicated for me to install.There are people on YouTube who have used higher powered video cards in the very same model of computer that I have, with the original power supply, to turn them into gaming machines, believe it or not, but I didn't need anything like that. I am grateful to those YouTubers, though, because that's how I learned to open my computer case to install the video card.The hardest part of the installation of this card was replacing the long metal slot-cover that is for full size computer towers with the included slot cover that is for small form factor cases. It's tricky to get the tiny screws back into place. You will need a very small Philips screwdriver.I'm happy to report that this new video card with its HDMI outputs allows me to use all the "real estate" of my 29-inch wide monitor and at the proper resolution. Windows 10 recognized it right away.I do notice a little bit of fan noise. Overall, though, I'm satisfied.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 11, 2023
reviews.reviewText: in tying to upgrade my new pc I purchased a graphics card -SAPLOS Radeon HD 6570Dual HDMI , 1G GDDR3 64bit . I thought Radeon was a Good brand, but I must say that My vacuum cleaner is just a little more quieter than this device wasn't worth the price or the trouble ! ! ! ( : - (

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars What a Difference.
reviews.reviewText: Installed it on my Dell PC. Easy to install software works well. Now my PC graphics looks like it’s in the 21st century. Great graphics. Worth the money.
